HelpXML.Title: mahalFS
HelpXML.Purpose: mahalFS computes Mahalanobis distances (in squared units) for each row of matrix Y

Item.Name: Y
Item.LongDesc: n x v data matrix; n observations and v variables. Rows of Y represent observations, and columns represent variables. Missing values (NaN's) and infinite values (Inf's) are allowed, since observations (rows) with missing or infinite values will automatically be excluded from the computations.

Item.Name: MU
Item.LongDesc: v x 1 vector containing centroid to use

Item.Name: SIGMA
Item.LongDesc: v x v matrix containing covariance matrix which must be used

Item.Name: d
Item.LongDesc: n x 1 vector which contains the squared Mahalanobid distances. \[ d(i) = (y_i-\mu)^T \times \Sigma^{-1} \times (y_i-\mu), \qquad i=1, 2, \ldots, n \]
